findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: MMU - Misleading Method Usages
findings.description: The contract includes functions designed to return and set specific state variables but are not utilized within the contract's internal logic or external interfaces, leading to a situation where functions are returning and setting data that does not influence or interact with the contract's operational processes.

findings.title: RED - Redudant Event Declaration
findings.description: The event `UpdateUniswapV2Router` is declared and not being used in the contract.

findings.title: RCI - Redundant Check Inefficiency
findings.description: The contract has redundant checks within nested if statements, specifically checking `to != owner()` twice, which is unnecessary and can lead to inefficiencies and confusion.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: UFC - Unused Functionality Concern
findings.description: The contract includes variables and functions related to trading activities, specifically the `tradingOn` boolean variable and the `enableTrading` and `swapTokensForEth` functions. However, these elements are never actually invoked within the contract.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not conform to Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block. When this happens, the local variable 'shadows' the outer variable, meaning that it takes precedence over the outer variable within the scope in which it is declared.

findings.title: L22 - Potential Locked Ether
findings.description: The contract contains Ether that has been placed into a Solidity contract and is unable to be transferred, potentially producing financial loss for users who have called the payable method.
